intro: Satyrium erectum, commonly known as the erect leek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
